desc: Excellent hotel, the service is second to none! Not sure why the hotel has a low ranking on trip advisor! I believe the hotel needs refurbishing, there‚Äôs a lack of halal food variety hence you don‚Äôt see many middle eastern staying there, I had to buy my food from outside the hotel, this can be improved but overall a top notch hotel..

title: Great experience
desc: The staff were all very attentive especially Kartie, who made us feel extremely welcome. The food spread was exellent and satisfying, including free flow seafood and caviar, which was perfect for a relaxing and lazy weekend brunch.

title: Excellent
desc: Excellent service throughout the stay. Special mention to Saravanan who was exceptional during breakfast service. Service was quick and efficient even though it‚Äôs crowded and he still had time to give extra attention to my kid and entertained him.

title: Top notch service
desc: Sofia was super helpful. And helped us with our valet parking. Awesome service, very attentive. Also very patient and on point. Really appreciate the effort and service. Highly recommend! Thanks for the help!

title: Excellent customer service
desc: Very friendly service by Saravanan , he‚Äôs well taking care of our table , promptly delivered his best customer servic The food is great n worth for value. Food displayed is great and ambient is cozy Sure will visit again for the good food and service

title: Business Trip
desc: Stayed for 3 days, Butler Froel was very resourceful, helped me to find good gifts for friends and helped me with various difficult tasks. The concierge service was a bit disappointing, I booked a hotel car at 6pm to get me to the dinner venue, but the hotel car didn't show up until 6:25pm.

title: Sous Chef Kamal - Hotel breakfast
desc: You must try the hotel breakfast here. My always have it over my weekend. A great improvement when Mr Kamal Housan (Sous Chef) took over. It has a great spread with quality ingredients. St Regis offer Acai Berry in the spread! Sous Chef Kamal has great personality and make you feel so welcome. He is a great asset to your organisation.

title: Service Centric - Sir Froel and Sir Durai
desc: I attended a business conference and our company booked us at St Regis and I could say the service is Luxury at its finest. Our flight is super early but they prepare for our luggage to be kept in a conference room and allowed us to rest. Special shoutout to Sir Froel and Sir Durai as they went above and beyond to ensure that we feel pampered after a long day of activities from the conference. They‚Äôre very friendly and attended to our requests. They even gave us fruit basket. And it was much appreciated. I would recommend St. Regis as a place of choice for your next SG trip :)

title: Old world luxury
desc: Well-appointed, old-world luxury. Our room buutler took very good care of us -- bringing us ice, drinks, and snacks promptly upon request. The bathroom amazing and I would cheerfully spend my entire stay there. Highly recommended!

title: An Amazing Hotel
desc: This is simply an amazing hotel, great check in great concierge service. The room was great and clean. The best part was the butler service, coffee tea water all brought to your door. The breakfast was terrific, the service in the restaurant could be a little better, but all up a great stay for our first time in the beautiful city of Singapore

title: Wonderful service
desc: The service is exceptional and the hotel is classically beautiful. I stayed for 2 months and everyday the staff impressed me. On my last day they even gave me a gift for a beautiful gift box of mooncakes. Thank you.

title: Very pleasant stay here
desc: My husband and I stayed here enroute to Seattle, in April. We landed early but we‚Äôre quite graciously welcomed and our room was made available immedialetly. The check in was swift, and we were taken quickly to our room - arriving after an overnight flight, we welcomed the comfort of the bed. The pleasantly appointed facilities, the enormous bath - it was most comfortable. We enjoyed the restaurant and the staff on duty there made it a most enjoyable meal. I would definitely opt to stay again on my next visit

title: Hands down the BEST hotel ever
desc: I have no words. This is the best hotel I‚Äôve ever stayed in Singapore. The room, the service, the Butler, the in-room dining, the whole experience made me felt like a true Queen. I love St Regis and I‚Äôll be back for sure.

title: Beautiful city hotel
desc: Loved the hotel! Conveniently placed in Tanglin road, so close to Orchard Road. The breakfast was very good with a lot of choices and both the Italian and Chinese restaurants had amazing food! Highly recommended!

title: Not as nice as the St. Regis in Bangkok or Kuala Lumpur
desc: OVERALL IMPRESSION:  Decent hotel, yet not up to St. Regis standards, and needs renovations, including the new St. Regis design package. The St. Regis per example in Bangkok or Kuala Lumpur is much better on every level compared to this property. LOCATION: 3/5 10-15min walk to Orchard Road, which is a shopping area - not in CBD or in the city center. ROOMS: 3/5 Old school: red, brow, gold. Posh but old. Some furniture is overused and doesn‚Äôt get replaced, staines on carpets in almost every guest room. STAFF / SERVICE: 3/5 Bell men: supereb Butler: average Front desk & Operator: poor RESTAURANTS / FOOD: 4/5 Something between OK and Good. Variety is average, staff is mostly attentive. SPA / FITNESS: 4/5 The gym is sufficient for cardio and weight lifting. The complimentary

title: Exceeded our Expectations
desc: This is 10/10 hotel. The hotel was beautiful and spotless and the staff very friendly, they could do enough for you. The breakfast was lovely, with good choice from the buffet and also you can order from the menu which is included in breakfast. Service was outstanding from Paisley, Chef Lai and Chef Lily. Clean and well equipped rooms, comfortable and fantastic bathroom. We really enjoyed our stay.

title: The Perfect Place
desc: With so many options in Singapore, we decided to try The St. Regis. We had only stayed at St. Regis Resorts and thought it was about time we tried one of their hotels. We absolutely made the right decision. Location was great. Upon arrival we were greeted by an outstanding bell staff who made us feel welcome. Shahryl checked us in and continued to make us feel like we were returning guests. He took the time to explain the facilities offered at the hotel, presented us with a pre-printed letter outlining what was available to us and took the time to make recommendations on restaurants that he thought we might enjoy. We had advised him that our cousins would be arriving shortly after our arrival and kept an eye out for them so he could handle their check in. The entire

title: Classy luxury at its best
desc: Very classy stay in one of the best locations in Singapore. Beautifully designed rooms with classic French marble and decor throughout the building. Very knowledgeable concierge, and excellent service including world class butler service. The breakfast a la carte had great options, while the buffet also lived up to our high expectations (loved the almond croissant!). Memorable experience in Singapore at St. Regis, would be happy to return in the near future.

title: ‚ÄûOld School‚Äú Luxury
desc: My husband and I had an amazing stay at the St. Regis during our honeymoon in June this year. It was the first St. Regis experience for us and I am still blown away. It‚Äòs really the little details that made this stay stand out from other 5* hotels we have stayed at so far: plush chairs to sit down when checking in at the reception desk, the cute stool in all the elevators and most of all the exceptionally polite, friendly and professional staff. I also really enjoyed the signature Butler Service - mostly to order espresso that was always promptly brought up to the room (my definition of heaven ;)) Oh and the divine chocolate cake that greeted us as a honeymoon present was an awesome surprise! The interior of the hotel and the rooms is what I would describe as ‚Äûold school luxury‚Äú

title: Great business hotel
desc: Centrally located, walking distance to most things. Beautiful opulent rooms, my ironing was delivered to my room same day and tea and coffee on demand delivered by the Butler. I opted to unpack and pack my own case but this is something the butlers routinely offer. Beautiful food, beautiful hotel and perfect for my business stay. I would return with family

title: Superb hotel in every way
desc: My husband and I travel frequently and The St Regis is one of our favourite hotels. It ticks all the boxes for an exceptional hotel in a city. It consistently delivers great service, spacious, luxurious rooms, conveniently located next to all the fabulous shopping and food on Orchard Road and great breakfasts. Our latest 5 night stay was no different. Thank you Vincent and Kartie for all your great service and making our stay extra special. We look forward to seeing you again at our next stay.

title: Good but not exceptional
desc: I had a 3 nights stay at the St Regis. The location is great as it is centrally located and very near the botanic gardens. Overall the service was ok but not exceptional. The gym is very small. I just found that compared to the other St Regis I visited, this was was below expectations. Good breakfast.

title: BEST QUALITY
desc: I had Afternoon tea at st.regis. Even the price is a bit costly compared to afternoon tea in other hotels, Its definitely worth-it. Not only quality of the food and others but also super friendly staff ! Thank you to specially "Dylan" for looking after us all the time making us special experience. I highly recommend this wonderful hotel.

title: Overall stay
desc: Excellent Service - housekeeping/ turn down service We ate at The Drawing Room and received excellent service from Irene and Angelie. Although we hit a bit of a snag during check out ( we had to wait, standing up, for 10-15 minutes) our overall Experience was still very good.

title: Luxury on its top..
desc: I recently visited the St. Regis hotel at Orchard, Singapore for four days. My experience there was fabulous and the service they provided was outstanding. The room they provided was very classy with a city view and we got many more services like mini bar and a handy phone which helped us to roam around the city with no fear. I recommend this hotel for the people who want a luxury stay.

title: Pampered
desc: Our first, but not our last, visit to St. Regis. From the moment you arrive you know that you will be well taken care of by the staff, all of whom - from doorman on up - go the extra step to provide you with the best service possible. The property is old-world elegant, and despite it's walkable proximity to Orchard, feels secluded from the hustle and bustle of the city. Nice workout facility, and a choice of fine dining. You won't want to leave!

title: Still lovely but..,
desc: Have always stayed at the St Regis when in Singapore- and it‚Äôs still aesthetically beautiful and refined. The butlers and food service staff are lovely. The team is mostly eager to do whatever you need to be happy. But things feel slightly less perfect now - zero poolside service, no one ever knew the weather forecast (a must in 5 star hotels), and I was called Mr more times than I care to remember (even though I corrected them in writing and verbally several times). The staff‚Äôs command of English I also found to be patchy. Some other niggles too. So it‚Äôs lost a tiny edge for me but I still applaud the intention (and the location is fabulous).

title: Good comment on yan ting restaurant serive
desc: We came for a 10 pax group birthday dinner on 27 July 2018. Mr Bruce Lee serviced us very very well. He is very friendly and provided an excellent service. Its a Michelin 3 star experience!! Thank you for the excellent service from Bruce! Eric chong

title: Wonderful Hotel in Orchard!!!
desc: Last week, we stayed at this hotel on our 4 days family trip. We were 7 in group including 2 kids. After our long transit flight arrived to hotel quite late check in was quick and smooth. Hotel has latest aminities one of the best hotel we ever stayed. Next monrming when wake up after short sleep late check inn and world cup semi final match we got amazing view from window. Only down side was breakfast. There was limited choices being must expensive hotel and must expensive breakfast I evere taken. Some of our extra order never arrive. I asked waiter actually he forgotten my order didn‚Äôt pass my order to the kitchen. Waiter even didn‚Äôt apolzise. Our expectation was high staying at big hotel. From next 3 morning we never took breakfast because of poor service. We ran around

title: A perfect Hotel in Singapore
desc: We 7 of us, two families came to stay in this hotel recently with two rooms for four nights. The rooms which we got on the 8th floor ( 816 and 817 ), The rooms were fabulous and modern with its bathroom and toilets. Both rooms were next to each other with an extra separate door for the separate two families which was great made for the two family use. We arrive at the hotel midnight, the check in was so great and friendly so the check out was, which was very early in the morning. We booked the hotel without breakfast, but we wanted to have breakfast with additional cost. the first morning we went to have breakfast at the restaurant nearby lobby, lots of choices, we asked for the eggs and pancake, which they took the order, but did not deliver, after waiting 20 minutes, we

title: Disappointing 10th anniversary planning
desc: I am celebrating my 10th year anniversary with my partner in January 2019, and wanted place a reservation for about 20 pax for the Sunday brunch at Brasserie Les Saveurs ‚Äì using the 2 Supper Club cards (and to get a suite). I spoke my Ambassador explaining that I would like to get the discount for this; and it is the same treatment that I received when I celebrated my birthday at Yan Ting (another restaurant at St Regis) last Oct. As the booking is for a sizable group, I was referred to the Events team. The events person called me on 4th Jul to inform that I am not able to have the discount for more than 10 pax - as the discount on one card is entitled to a max of 10 persons. She further explained that it is not expected for both cardholders to be presenting their cards at the

title: Good service
desc: In general we experienced very good service and high quality everywhere. Check-in: we arrived very early morning from Europe, and was offered our room immediately even though check-in time was in the afternoon. Rooms: spacious room and a large bathroom. We have an extra bed in our room for a child, and even with that, and a lot of luggage, there was plenty of space. Comfortable beds. Breakfast: from other reviews we noted a lot of complaints about waiting time. We didn‚Äôt need to wait for entering the restaurant, and our orders for eggs, pancakes etc arrived quickly. Fitness: nice and well-equipped fitness room. Pool: nice, but not that many chairs and a bit boring hidden away behind walls. Large beach towels.

title: Misleading information on website
desc: We booked a penthouse room which , on its website at time of making the online booking, specified that evening cocktail was included in the package. However, while checking in at the hotel, we were told that we would have only 1 complimentary drink in the bar. There is no lounge at St Regis even if you book for the more expensive rooms. There is no afternoon tea provided either in this hotel! So be very careful while doing a booking at St Regis. Fortunately, they agreed to cancel our booking as we considered it was not worth value for money. Furthermore, the Bastien Gonzalez pedicure in this hotel is far from its signature ttreatment that we have experienced in Atlantis, Dubai! Not worth it again.

title: The wow factor BUT
desc: My wife and I stayed at the St Regis as part of a luxury escapes deal in Singapore The check In service and quality of this hotel is the best we have been to anywhere in Singapore The staff are fantastic so friendly and helpful u could not ask for anything better The breakfast is outstanding from ordering off the menu to extra off the buffet fantastic The rooms are awesome clean modern and specious just the best Only down side was a huge deduction on our credit card a few days after we arrived home with no idea what it was for They were very quick to add it on but not so quick to explain why it was added a week later and still waiting Not good for a great hotel Must be trying to pay for the summit

title: Poor Service by Ms Cindy at The Drawing Room
desc: I was at The Drawing Room, St Regis on Sunday, 8 July 2018, 815pm and was very upset to be served by Ms Cindy who had very bad service. I sincerely hope the effective management can explain and apply immediate service recovery action.

title: Perfect.
desc: This is a great location on Orchard Road on the West side of the city, it's quiet/residential, by the Botanical Gardens, close to train and bus stations and across the road from the Manhattan Bar (review coming). The staff are world class, everyone is smiling and ready to help. The Breakfast is incredible as are the Breakfast staff. The room we had looked over the city towards the Botanical Gardens, huge windows but still very very quiet. The Astor Bar at night was great, if you are a Scotch drinker this is your bar, the Piano was at the PERFECT volume, you didn't have to raise your voice to have a good conversation with the Bar Tender which is what we did. We would return to the St Regis and give it the highest marks. Great Hotel and thank you for making our stay in Singapore

title: Celine Dion Concert / Short Getaway
desc: The moment we stepped out from the hotel. We‚Äôve been greeted with the sweetest smile. The staff Angela at the front desk was so helpful, thank you so much Angela. Love the St. Regis TeaBlend where TWG specially make only for St. Regis (Black & Green Tea combine) and it was lovely. The room is spacious and nice. Love the deco of the room, nose sound system, the bathrobe, the bed, the pillow... everything was perfect! The breakfast... just WOW! I do not want to say much here, but you will find out when you‚Äôre there. So booked your room including breakfast üòçüòç We tried the fine dining at the French Restaurant on our last day in Singapore. The food was lovely and the waiter Kuai was excellent. From his explanation on the food, he is so helpful and always smiling. I‚Äôm so

title: Stay at St Regis Singapore / beyond expectation??
desc: We stayed 2 nights at St Regis Singapore, came quite often there in the last 6 years. Rooms are very nice, butler service ok but not so perfect like in other St Regis hotels. You get just service when you ask, in other St Regis hotels butler offer after arrival ironing, coffee, shoe shine etc VERY POSITIV to mention are the doormen. Always friendly and helpful. At another stay at Regis the doorman realised that my Rimowa lagguge was damaged (wheel not working). He brought me after one day a brand new one without any costs (world wide warranty). The Astro Bar is the one highlight of the hotel, you can enjoy live music with champagne, wine and cocktails. There is a very good soloist performer ( Ron Sinclair) every eve, beautiful songs and voice, very motivated, seldom a big

title: Lovely stay!
desc: I had a brief stay of two nights for a work conference at St Regis. The room is very well appointed as one would expect for St Regis. The Butler advice is very handy if you need a cup of coffee or small snacks (although it may take a long while to get through at night time). Breakfast offers a nice spread and I enjoyed the a la carte egg dishes which are included in the buffet. The only room for improvement that I can observe is on the service front, whether it is the door man, noodle bar, concierge desk, and check out. The quality of service that I received fell short of the rest of this wonderful hotel.

title: St Regis provides royal service to near- and wannabe-kings
desc: Along with the Four Seasons, the Regent, the Shangri-La, and the Mandarin Orchard, one of the five 5-star-plus hotels located within walking distance of Orchard Road, the main shopping district of Singapore. Its location on the edge makes it easier to ‚Äòprotect‚Äô from a security viewpoint, and therefore a favourite destination for important foreign dignitaries, like Kim Jong Un; in that sense the Shangri-La is even easier to ‚Äòcordon‚Äô and was where the Donald recently stayed. Service is excellent, including the legendary St Regis butler. Shinjii by Kanesaka has an outlet here. I personally prefer the more personal and intimate Four Seasons hotel.

title: Memorable, Opulent Luxury with Gaps in Guest Experience
desc: In October 2018, I checked into the Grand Deluxe room at The St. Regis Singapore, which is situated within the prime Orchard shopping district and minutes away from Orchard MRT station as well as major shopping destinations like ION Orchard, Isetan and Takashimaya. The 299-room property is one of the country‚Äôs most opulent addresses, and has in recent times hosted esteemed guests ranging from Prince Harry to Kim Jong Un. THE ST. REGIS SINGAPORE From the moment you pass the luxury cars parked in the driveway and the grand chandelier in the foyer, you are greeted by a strong sense of old-world opulence. The hotel premises are dotted with various exquisite artworks, from Picasso paintings in Astor Bar (!?) to multiple sculptures by renowned Columbian artist Fernando Botero, the

title: Good location
desc: The hotel is well located. Has a good breakfast spread. The overall ambiance is pleasant. I am a vegetarian, there are very limited options of vegetarian food. Must work on bringing in options for Vegetarians.

title: Superb stay
desc: Such a fantastic stay. Everything was perfect. The room, the people, the service. The staff is really great in making sure all the guests receive adequate attention. The decoration over the holidays are fantastic as well.

title: Disappointing Stay !
desc: Besides the luxury and opulent hotel decor, hotel services are overrated and overhyped ! Disappointing overall stay especially with check-in experience; high tea and breakfast experience at the hotel Brasserie les Saveurs restaurant. Room #1413 aircon was blowing hot and cold. Aircon was ok during the day but erratic at night.. strange ? At night, initial room temp set at 23 deg C but both still feeling stuffy. So reset room temp to 18 deg C at max fan. However, aircon was blowing hot and cold throughout the night.. causing us sleepless night !

title: Best stay ever!
desc: It is a great pleasure to recognize the extrsordinary service we received during our stay from 21-27 November 2018. We had a lovely penthouse room on the 19th floor where we enjoyed the fabulous service of our butler Rafeeq and his staff, particularly Amy Nguyen. Their attention to detail, kindness and service is truly remarkable and admirable. We would also like to recognize the excellent chefs and staff members of this fabulous hotel: Chefs Fabio, Ethan and Wendy!! They are the best!!!! Also Irene, Alex, Kristine and Manish. At the bar, they were spectacular: Imran and Lorena. In the administrative staff, they are all amazing too: Madhu, Delia, Denise and Giselle. The entire staff was beyond superlative and extraordinary and every single staff member should be recognized for

title: Wedding & hotel experience
desc: We held our wedding banquet at The St Regis Hotel Singapore on 10 November 2018. Throughout the whole process of about a year or so up till the very day of my hotel stay, the staff have been very professional in ensuring that everything went smooth-sailing. Special thanks to Christine Wang for her professionalism in ensuring I had a luxurious and comfortable stay at the suite. I never had to fret about hiccups when I liaised with her. As for our butlers, Amanda & Lester, thumbs up for the excellent service!

title: Beautiful hardware, good location, inconsistent standard
desc: We really liked the location of this hotel, just a short walk to Orchard Street and yet not too close to the hustle and bustle, and therefore came back for our 2nd visit. The check in was similar to last time, we received bright smiles, courtesy, efficiency and then it stopped there. The agent learned that we had a 5-hour flight delay; that this is our 2nd visit; that we had recommended the hotel to our family (so 3 rooms in total were booked for this stay) - all of these were acknowledged with big smiles and head nodding but nothing more. Honestly it was very disappointing that as a SPG Platinum member, we did not receive an upgrade and were just kept in a Deluxe Room right next to the elevator. As mentioned, we had a 5-hour flight delay and our family was traveling with

title: Singapore
desc: This morning I had a wonderful pancake at st regis breakfast,a chef call hongda is so polite he even served to my table.i ask him where is the famous place to go in Singapore and he recommended me a lot of place . St regis is the best hotel to stay,I hope to come back again

title: Good option on Orchard Road
desc: St Regis can do more to its decor this Season for more festive cheer. Overall the staff try hard and the Orchard location is great and convenient . Rooms with garden views will show off the beautiful tropical landscape, a huge part of Singapore‚Äôs attractiveness . Room size at more than 50 metres is great. Room follows a luxurious design, and is comfortable . Here & there eg inside the shower you can see the age of the place .

title: Beautiful Property
desc: Excellent location, beautiful classy finishes are the 2 main plus points of this hotel. Check in was very smooth and both attendants were very welcoming and friendly. We got an upgrade to one of their corner suites. Although the suites are a bit small the finishings are excellent. The building is very well insulated and we couldn't hear anything from the hallways or adjacent room. As with all the St Regis properties, bedding, towels and toiletries were excellent. Astor Bar is charming and the staff was also very friendly. The pool isn't very big, the gym overlooks the pool area as well. Unfortunately breakfast wasn't up to the standard of any other St Regis, mainly due to the fact that the restaurant was understaffed, so it's not really their fault. It took a long time to get

title: Spa services are amazing!!
desc: Beautiful hotel, great staff, pleasant and very professional. Love the treatment received at the spa, skin therapist Hilda was amazing, clearly had a lots of experience and simply very caring personality! Only positive memories!!

title: Fantastic Hotel
desc: Been here now for the past 3 days and the service is first class. Platinum recognition is super given a suite on arrival. Everyone appears to no my name and can‚Äôt do enough for me. Denise the Food and Beverage Director is really on it she seems to be there 24/7 breakfast /lunch and dinner very visible every time I am in reception area. Always asking how things are and if I need anything. She is a real ambassador for St Regis. If you are in Singapore this IS the place to stay. Quality of the rooms and comfort you will not beat. I spend 125 + nights and I no hotels. Stay here you will not be disappointed. Thank you all at the St Regis fo r making this stay a true Home from Home

title: Brunch
desc: I wish to thank chef niroshan...i eat banana donuts,cheese sticks,sour bread it very good...I never eat like this pastrys in my life...he is very friendly guy and very joyful...I really enjoy chef niroshan foods...next time also come to enjoy this foods...and i thank for f&b team they give us excellent service...

title: Awesome hotel!!!
desc: Located in Orchard Road belt so location is superb! Given the top floor opposite the Presidential suite, so finds it very fascinating. Plus the room is classy and elegant and the amenities are luxurious! Butler service and staff at the hotel are warm, friendly and professional. Will definitely visit again!

title: Simply Luxurious
desc: My husband I stayed at The St Regis Singapore after our wedding ceremony which was held at the Grand Ballroom. We were offered The St Regis suite. The room was immensely luxurious and comfortable and it's cleanliness was impeccable. Service from all the hotel staff were excellent throughout the 3 days, all the staff were really friendly and they accommodated our requests at all instances. We had a truly relaxing and enjoyable experience at the hotel.

title: Not so excellent
desc: Now we are staying in St Regis Singapore, comparing with St Regis in Abu Dhabi I was dissapointed, cleaning is not good, no complimentary fruit plate and sweets before sleeping, no coffee machine and wardrobe in standard room. Expected more

title: True sense of hospitality
desc: Went for a coffee at The St. Regis Singapore while waiting for a friend to meet. Upon my arrival at the lobby, the bell boy greeted me with the warmest and genuine smile I could possibly remember whilst traveling to Singapore. It is somewhat rare I find. He saw me with the umbrella and offered me the plastic cover to prevent from dripping. Went in ‚Äì I let myself to enter The Drawing Room, as it was the appointed place. After settling down, the wait staff was also sincerely greeted with the most beautiful smile and patiently introduce each item on the menu. My eyes caught Chinese Green Herbal tea but then 5-minute later, I thought having Cappuccino is far more needed. I wish to share and remember to acknowledge the wait staff name but I was brave enough traveling without my

title: Best branch.best pepale
desc: Its gread pleasuure to meet lovely staff like ms denise.and chef niroshan. Wow denise and niroshan so kind .very freindly.and humbale.smile. Chef nirosh your pastrys are wow. We never had befor. Pretzel are same like germen. Do no what to eat. Staff all so so good. We really come back to st rigis singapore. Chef niroshan and denise we hope to see you soon. Excellent bread. Thank you denise and niroshan

title: Sterling, simply sterling
desc: Incredible hotel - from lobby to room - this establishment personifies world-class service. In fact, was picked up in a chauffeured limo from Changi to the property. Stayed at the Lady Astor room - luxurious. Comes with one's very own butler! From making your tea, to handling your laundry ... even to ironing your newspaper - the butler ensures one's very own whim and fancy. Makes you feel royalty-like. The room was astounding - enveloped in extravagance such as a Bose surround sound system to a comfy sofa by the window. The bathroom was equally amazing - imagine this: I could watch my favourite flicks whilst soaking in the bath tub. The shower stall had a choice of rain-shower, spa-like high-pressured waterjets, and your regular shower - all in one. Breakfast was equally

title: Best birthday treat!
desc: We stayed at Lady Astor Room, and it comes complete with a 24-hour butler service. We made full use of it with the complimentary ironing, free flow of freshly brewed coffee and tea, anytime of the day, and also shoe shine service. The room was superb, bed super comfie, and nicely located at the end of the floor, privacy maintained. Loved the bath tub and decor. Breakfast choice was extensive, from western to varieties of Asian dishes. The sous chef, Kamal Hossen, personally attended to us and served us Paratha, even though it wasn‚Äôt on the breakfast buffet fare. It was yummy, right texture of flakiness. Highly recommended!

title: Perfect for that special occasion
desc: We had stayed in a Caroline Astor Suite over the weekend during my birthday. We arrived early and were pleasantly informed that our room was already waiting for us. The suite was elegantly furnished, impeccably clean and extremely spacious. We were given a rich chocolate cake which was a nice touch but we couldn't finish it because it was too large. In general, the service provided was professional and of the highest quality. We were very pleased with the personalised check in service and the St Regis butler team which made our stay a pleasant one. We had evening drinks at the Astor Bar which was accompanied by some live jazz music. We had breakfast at Brasserie Les Saveurs which was as good as it gets anywhere in town. One pointer is that during peak seasons, the hotel opens

title: Memorable stay at St Regis
desc: My family and I spent a magnificent 3 night stay at the St Regis Singapore in one of their bedrooms with two double beds. It exceeded our expectations from beginning to end... The hotel had remembered our anniversary and prepared a magnificent cake waiting for us upon check in. The check in process was quick and efficient and the staff that accessed us very friendly and professional. The bedroom was big with exceptional closets though some features in the bedroom such as the TV in the bathroom did not work... As a titanium member I had the pleasant surprise to be offered two drinks at the Astor Bar downstairs. The breakfast in the morning was exceptional. The quality, the taste as well as the impressive variety made it a joy for us to wake up every morning. It was a bit crowded

title: Great Staff and Nicely Appointed Rooms
desc: We stayed at the St. Regis for two nights! We used Suite Vouchers and were upgraded to the Carolyn Astor Suite. The suite was spacious and clean. The room showed a bit of wear and tear, however, it was clean nonetheless. Our Butler was very accommodating and came to check on us during our 2AM arrival. The location is great. I would definitely stay here again.

title: Awesome Arts & People :=)
desc: Unforgettable family staycation during the long weekend. Butler Santha gave an excellent guided tour of the inspiring art works in this luxury hotel. What a real treat for our eyes!   Our kids enjoyed their bubble bath in the standalone bathtub, enhanced by the TV screen in front and the sense surround audio system.   The spa facilities were fantastic. A quiet zone for relaxing and recharging.   All the staff were extremely friendly and greeted our kids by name.

title: National Day staycation
desc: One of the most awesome staycation we had! The room was really nicely decorated and the city view of the botanical garden was great too. My daughter really enjoyed the bathtub and the large bed while we enjoyed the breakfast and great service provided. Great job!

title: are you sure st regis singapore is a 5 star hotel?
desc: so many wrong things going on this hotel from the beginning we came. check-in queue for check-in is quite take some time. after 30 mins wait in our room, the luggage had not been delivered to us. we had to call concierge 2 times and explain we were in a hurry to leave the hotel and must take our belonging in the luggage. staff we back to hotel after shopping spree at 10. NO ONE take or offer our shopping bags to be taken from the taxi. the staff just stay there like a mannequin. we must take the shopping bags on our own from taxi to the room. room our room is 814 and the curtain had a hole on it. and check the bathtub, it's dirty and black in the base of the bathtub from the beginning we came. like no one take care of the room. check-out at night we call the concierge that

title: Birthday Staycay
desc: AMAZING! ‚Äì nothing lesser than that. I‚Äôm amazed by the hospitality and service given by each and every one in the team. Starting from the commissionaire to the butler, purely world-class. As soon as I reach the lobby of the hotel, I could feel the difference in ambience and the good vibes it brought alongside it. Greeted warmly by Ms Nooreen that assisted me to the concierge to get me checked-in. Ms Alina was the lady that was on duty to checked us in and she guided us throughout the check-in process. The process was so smooth that I didn‚Äôt even had to provide my booking number to her. She just requested for my last name and all the details are there. She then continued to usher me to the lift lobby up to my room where Ms Nooreen was already there to greet me once again

title: Third time's a charm
desc: There are lots of beautiful hotels to pick from in Singapore, however we have stayed with The St. Regis Singapore primarily because of the incredibly generous and thoughtful staff. The location is very convenient to Orchard Road and world class shopping.

title: Best run hotel in Singapore
desc: All St. Regis hotels are nice and comfortable. I think what sets Singapore apart is the attention to detail and bend-over-backwards desire to make your stay wonderful. I get this sense from all the employees, from the bell hops and doormen to the GM. I travel to Singapore very frequently and have tried just about all the five star properties. None of the others hold up to the St. Regis standards.

title: Branch
desc: We never had this kind of bread branch in singapore. Wow it awsome bread display. The best in singapore We love it. Thank you st regis and baker chef we havent meat yat. Make our sunday si happy. Thank you st regis Best best bread.

title: Pleasant stay after a difficult start
desc: Got in very late on a weekday night and this visit to the St Regis Singapore did not start well. No one was at the front door, and the front desk attendant seemed a little behind the ball. Well the good news is, the hotel came through and really delivered. Room was very nice, spacious and well-thought out as far as closet space and bathroom size (only downside is that the shower seal was not strong, leaving leaks outside the shower after each usage). Remede bathroom amenities were great. Bathtub was perfect for soaking. Gym was spacious and has a lot of aerobic equipment but really needs a proper elliptical machine or two. There's some good weightlifting nautilus equipment plus some assorted dumbbells and kettlebells. Got in a nice workout. Customer service was good,

title: They certainly know how to make their guests feel special!
desc: This is our first time staying at the St. Regis Singapore. To be honest, it wasn't our first choice because we have stayed at the other 5-star hotels in the same area with cheaper rates and the experience had always been satisfactory. With our twin boys getting older, it was difficult to find a hotel that would allow all 4 of us to be in the same room. I'm glad we decided on St. Regis because our stay was simply perfect in every single way. We stayed in the Lady Asther room with 2 queen sized beds. It was so invitingly spacious, well furnished, and comfortable. The butler service was also available 24hr and we could order complimentary coffee or hot chocolate to be sent to the room anytime. I think our boys love the bathroom the most! It was also spacious and gorgeous.

title: Great Stay at The St. Regis Singapore
desc: Quick layover in Singapore for 1 night with my son. Hotel was full due to it being a public holiday, hotel upgraded us to a beautiful suite and Giselle and her team made us feel right at home. Everything from the location to the professionalism of the staff was first class, can't wait to return.

title: Chinese restaurant service HORRIBLE
desc: Been going to St Regis since my grandmother's time. Celebrated multiple milestones there and consistently brought overseas guests there too. Particularly, the standard of service for the Chinese restaurant, YanTing has been getting from bad to worse. The previous (male) manager was polite, respectful and spoke in a soft yet firm and dignified way, managing all situations appropriately. One eg was, Last year, when I made a birthday booking for the private rooms and there was oversight from the restaurant. But at least he took the trouble to call and made an apology and gave alternatives. Now this new (female) manage of YanTing is just rude, obnoxious, extremely loud, and behaves arrogantly. On top of that, she doesn't even get her facts right before shouting at customers.

title: Great food; great stay!
desc: I've stayed quite a few times at the St. Regis Singapore over the years. Each time I return there it is a lot like coming home -- but only if your home is super luxurious with attentive support staff! This time I stayed a couple of nights on my way back to Malaysia after a vacation in New Zealand and Australia. For this review, I'll focus specifically on the excellent spread at breakfast. I particularly found Mr Kartie attentive. I had asked for salted butter for my toast on the first morning and was told they didn't have any. I simply shrugged that off and went on to enjoy a great morning meal. But Kartie pursued the matter and told me he would source salted butter for me the following morning. That is precisely what he did. Kudos! Also, the Indian food was excellent. I

title: Great Service!
desc: Excellent service as always in my visits and outstanding Hotel staff!! Would like to refer the competence, professionalism and excellent service of William from the SPA. Also had a need for a butler twice for service and both times (also wasn't my butler as explained) it was outstanding service and support from Jasper!

title: AMAZING
desc: Had a difficult time choosing which hotel to stay at considering there are so many great ones in Singapore! SO HAPPY WE DECIDED TO GO WITH ST REGIS! Everything was so wonderful from the moment we checked in to the moment we checked out. Sage welcoming and the receptionist who helped us was also so sweet and warm! The breakfast buffet was probably one of the best I have ever been to! The chef Niroshan Gamage made the very best food and even came to our table to make sure everything was okay! Will definitely be coming back to the St Regis next time we visit Singapore!

title: Lovely!
desc: We have been to St. Regis a few times and our recent trip was during F1 season. It was lovely. People were kind and very helpful. Rooms were up to standard, very peaceful and comfortable. The Lady Astor Double Room is a must! Sarah (I think that's her name - sorry. She's from Damansara in Malaysia) helped us check in and she was so on the ball. Breakfast at Brasserie Les Saveurs was lovely. The spread was delightful and we couldn't have asked for more. Service was great. Mescon was always at our table and he knew exactly what we required. Butler service - very convenient. Location - were were very close to shopping. Definitely returning! Some feedback for the hotel though - there were a lot of ants in the room.

title: Excellent Client Service; Fantastic Stay
desc: It was a lush experience with unparalleled customer service - friendly staff, ready to help clients with hotel requirements, excellent rooms, and complete amenities. I just found the lobby sparse and lacking in 5-star quality, unlike The Regent. Cleaning staff can be seen all over the place when it could have been less obvious. Otherwise, everything was excellent.

title: People make all the difference at the St Regis Singapore
desc: We really enjoy this hotel. The rooms are beautiful and fresh, the fitness center well-equipped, but the best thing about it are the people. For example, Assistant Chief Baker Sivapal Satheeskanth not only bakes amazing breads and the perfect scones, but he also remembers from one year to the next what KIND of breads I like and then bakes copious amounts of them for me. He also makes sure I have ample supplies to take with me on the flight. Amazing! Similarily, Madhu Wilmotte who runs the rooming division walks the hotel floor constantly, looking for people to encourage and support. She's incredibly energetic and positive,a person who ignore obstacles and will do anything to meet a guest's needs. We return to this hotel every year because of this culture and

title: Always a pleasure
desc: Stayed here numerous times over the period of 2 months and always had an amazing stay. I especially loved the butler service who was always willing to go the extra mile. One time I accidentally broke my glasses and asked for a super glue, and the butler delivered. Breakfast was also a delight, they have an a la carte menu (with dishes like omelette with caviar) in addition to the buffer spread. Food orders came pretty fast as well which I really appreciated especially in the morning when things were a little hectic. The bar has a nice atmosphere in the evening. I also enjoyed the pool for downtime in the afternoon. With that said, I have encountered a room where the shower stall has a rather unpleasant smell. Room refurbishment is probably needed soon. Overall, I highly

title: 5 stars for the luxury room but 4 stars only for the dining experience
desc: Booked an Executive Deluxe room for one night with my wife and daughter. Being a Marriott Bonvoy Gold member, I received a room upgrade to a big room on a high floor. The room was luxuriously appointed and had a huge bathroom. It reminded me of another of their group hotel - The Ritz Carlton in Tokyo which I had previously stayed. That night we had dinner in the French restaurant Brasserie Les Saveurs. It was a seafood buffet with live piano music but the buffet food choices were rather limited. The next morning we had breakfast in the same place. The restaurant is not big so it was crowded during breakfast time. The breakfast buffet selection was also rather limited. I would have expected St.Regis to offer a large buffet spread with many dishes to choose but that was

title: Exceptional hospitality and service
desc: We held our solemnization early December. Norynn and the butler team extended their best and exceptional service to ensure everything went smoothly for our solemnization. Norynn personally went above and beyond her call of duty to see this through to ensure we were assisted accordingly. Our 4D3N stay at the ST.Regis suite has been a truly memorable one not to forget the little touches of complimentary gifts and notes to us. Thank You

title: Good first time 2-night stay at opulence St Regis Singapore
desc: We decided to take up the Marriott Vacation Club's offer for a two night stay to try this high end St Regis Singapore hotel at a slightly discounted price mid Dec'19 on our way back from Taiwan during our transit in Singapore. We were with our 1 year old baby girl, and had an overall nice short stay. Pros: 1) Central location St Regis is centrally located next to Orchard road shopping district. It costs us SGD$38 (including $10 peak surcharge) taxi from Changi airport to the hotel during peak period 7:30pm, while a taxi from hotel to Changi airport is only SGD$18 during low peak time (12pm) The bonus is there is an SMRT public bus stop literally opposite the hotel which has many buses going to all parts of Singapore (Suntec Shopping mall & Bugis Junction were 20min bus ride at

title: Ending our trip with a high note
desc: St. Regis Singapore is more than just a hotel. It is an experience. The definition of hospitality and excellent service. During our Singapore-Malaysia trip, we planned to stay in St. Regis before our flight back home. This is because we knew how good the experience can be based on our previous stay in other St. Regis hotel, and we want to make the last night of our trip memorable. I know that staying in St. Regis is guaranteed to have the best service. Not until we met Sarah Ti and her team. The once we thought "best service" from other St. Regis, was just beaten by a huge margin. The butler team handled us from pre to post-stay flawlessly, from asking us for any request before check-in to providing high-attention to details from the butler team. Apart from that, and what

title: A great hotel in a central location
desc: St Regis Marriott is located at the top of Orchard Road in Singapore and is very handy to the main shopping areas. The hotel has a range of rooms but we opted for the larger twin Lady Astor room which did not disappoint. Coffee and tea making facilities were an added bonus. The hotel restaurants provided excellent meals both western and Chinese. Highly recommended at a reasonable price

title: Great for family staycations with kids
desc: We did a family staycation over the new year and were amazed by the level of service, especially since we weren't expecting St. Regis to be particularly welcoming to children. We were completely wrong! The check-in staff gave us a warm welcome the minute we stepped into the hotel and the guest relations officer, Sarah, immediately engaged my 2 young kids and gave them each a pack with games and a cap inside. She even showed them how to play the game to entertain them while we checked in. The kids really loved her! She was even available via whatsapp in case we needed anything, on top of the butler services that came with the room (we didn't call the butler though, so unable to comment on that). Really top-notch service and so very welcoming. Oh, they even gave us kid-sized

title: Fantastic experience
desc: The St Regis was a wonderful stay in Singapore. Its opulent setup with the Beautiful Christmas tree was a sight for the eyes. Try their special tea blend if you can. The bar has live music and songs in the evening with a great whisky selection. Free butler service in the room. Great breakfast buffet. The service is good too, had some issues with the laundry but they resolved it immediately. Will stay there again.

title: 2 night stay
desc: The stayed at 19th floor, room it‚Äôs ok... a little small compare to other luxury hotels... the breakfast is ok too... no welcome champagne, pastries or fruits upon arrival... the concierge didn‚Äôt not mention about breakfast. The butler is kinda on a rush hour mode... it‚Äôs a bit different service were expecting... I think Hilton properties is way better compare to Marriott... not sure if we‚Äôre going to see some Marriott properties...

title: A splendid Sunday to start off a new decade at the St Regis Singapore
desc: Arrived at the hotel at 1 pm and was promptly attended to by doorman Shah, bell captain Loges and bellman Kartik. Greeted in the lobby by Front of House Manager Magdeleine Chew whom I have known for over eleven years. The multilingual Sage from Guest Experience served me the signature welcome iced tea and she always remembers that I prefer it to be served in a tall glass - talk about service! Greeted by Cheryl and Amy at reception. My room was ready and I made my way upstairs to get ready for the St Regis Sunday brunch since I heard the inimitable Carol Gomez was singing today Reached my room to find housekeeper Hugo had set it up according to my preferences, including placing extra bath mats in the bathroom, thanks Hugo! Called Butler Services and talked to the manager,

title: Sunday Brunch
desc: It's hard to know where to start..... What a wonderful dinning experience! The standard of food on offer was very high and presented beautiful y, the astounding and disappointing part of the day was the lack of knowledge from the staff!! Clearly there had been no training completed as no one knew anything about the wine on offer, let alone the food. Something you don't expect at this hotel!! We enjoyed our lunch, the place is well worth the visit, but the price you pay should cover well versed staff with a complete understanding of the wine and the menu. One of my daughters (16yo) decided she wanted one of the selections from the kids menu as her main, it was delivered on a kiddie plastic plate!!

title: One of the best!
desc: Me and my fiancee stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and it was so awesome! It‚Äôs one of the best experiences we‚Äôve had. And we travel a lot! :) The afternoon tea with Manolo Blahnik was delicious and special. Not to mention that all meals at this hotel are really really good quality and delicious. And the room service is wow. We ordered breakfast in room, went to the perfect massage and when we checked out the butler packed our stuff. I would share some cons but I didn‚Äôt notice any. Sorry :) Thank you, St.Regis, you are the top. Definitely recommend!

title: Beautiful hotel with fantastic staff
desc: We were impressed from the moment we walked through the door of this hotel. The concierges and the check in staff made an immediate impression of professionalism. Our suite was impressive with every convenience we needed and a very comfortable bed. The cleaners were incredibly polite and accomodating, we met the Deputy Head Butler who gave us an informative 1 hour tour of the art works held in the hotel finished with a glass of champagne at the hotel's evening event on the staircase where a bottle of champagne is opened in a ceremony. Back to the concierges, I was amazed how they all remembered our names, there was a young man with a limp who was incredibly polite and engaging always ready for a chat. I've stayed in a lot of hotels but without reservation, this hotel has

title: Great Hotel
desc: Stayed at this beautiful hotel with the excellent staff who could not do more, The staff actively accommodated your every need and were friendly and polite. We will be returning due to this experience. My wife celebrated her birthday while we were there and cake, chocolates, card and balloons were left in our room from the staff! We will definitely be returning.

title: Hotel and staff are awesome
desc: Rooms are well appointed. Staff is fabulous. Breakfast buffet is worth it. Third time we stayed here and always excellent. Plus Tanglin area is fun. Recommend the afternoon tea service and the delicious St Regis tea.

title: Two visits here within 30 days and it is excellence personified
desc: This grand dame of a hotel is a wonderful reliable elegant choice - tranquil respite from the hot hustle and bustle of the city. A special shout out to RAJA, one of the hotel's excellent bellmen, who took 45 minutes to repair our broken suitcase zipper - a superstar.

title: Lovely Hotel!!!
desc: Loved our stay here. Very conveniently located in the heart of Singapore. The hotels is well kept and the staff is nice. Only drawback are the rooms, which are rather small. We are never much in the room so did not bother us.

title: Superb
desc: Decided to splurge on 1 night stay entourage home. What an awesome hotel. Exceptional customer service Feels like visiting a mansion - yet very homely Amazing butler service Most comfortable bed - and bed linen So quiet Best turndown service Pure indulgence Will definitely return for a longer stay !

title: Amazing service, short walk to Orchard
desc: Recently been to a few staycay and St Regis really has the best customer service. Pre-check in communications, clear messages, guaranteed timings, post-check in follow ups, additional perks if available.....St Regis really showed a prime example of how good hospitality can get. Really impressed with the service. You‚Äôll definitely enjoy your stay.

title: A royal stay
desc: I stayed in St Regis back in January 2020 but did not manage to write a review before. I believe there were no significant changes so my experiences might be relevant I stayed in many properties in Singapore, and I found rooms in St Regis the most beautiful. Felt like a princess‚Äô chamber (in a good way) The hotel does not have an infinity pool but I liked to swim in a garden one. Breakfast was also very good - and they did an avo-toast just for me noticing that I'm not eating any meat And famous St.Regis service was also there/ my butler was extremely considerate, and he brought my evening tea / took my clothes for ironing Wish I could come back soon.

title: Lovely hotel, excellent service mostly
desc: Spent two nights there in January. Enjoyed the comfortable, large room and the good service, especially from the reception and concierge. Bathroom and shower were spacious and nice. They also provided hand sanitisers and masks. We didn't bother to try the breakfast, as we like to laze in, when on holidays. So I was a little disappointed when I asked the butler service for some extra coffee, and was told that they had to limit the number of packets to four. Four for two persons over 3 days? I mean, sure, I could ask again the next day, but isn't that silly? Also, even though decaf was listed in their menu options, it was not available. Except for this little kink, everything else was great.

title: Thank you for the exceptional hospitality
desc: I wanted to drop this short note to thank StR for the warm welcome to the House of Astor and the generous hospitality extended to myself, my wife and my infant daughter throughout our recent stay from 26 ‚Äì 28 Feb as we celebrated special moments in our lives. Staff We interacted with no less than a dozen of StR staff, from the doorman (Mr Rahim), your FOH check-in staff, the StR butlers and breakfast servers and walked away with a huge impression. That coupled with the fact that there‚Äôs a known shortage of staff in the hotel industry makes this even more impressive. While I am not that particularly great at sneakily peeking at name badges and remembering names of your exceptional staff that way, a shout-out goes to the FOH reception staff handling our check-in who was

title: Extended honeymoon
desc: Had a great extended honeymoon experience at this hotel. Welcomed with some cake and chocolates to celebrate our new marriage. The butler service is superb‚Äî big thanks to Wilbur for accommodating all our requests and for all the honeymoon treats. Breakfast is great too! The room and the bathroom are exceptional even though we only booked the Executive Deluxe. Love the jet massage shower and the bath tub. They have smart tv too so you can mirror your phone. Will definitely come back! Highly recommended.

title: 9 nights at this amazing hotel
desc: I personally have been coming to the St Regis for years and since I was a teen. This hotel never fails in the service aspect. It is covid times now and the team have been working hard to continue to ensure that their weekend slams are effectively handled and I must say this is one of the few hotels that can do so in such grace. Maddy and her front office team are superb, the check in experience and out for guests remains the same as pre-covid. The Remede spa has always been my favourite spa in singapore and I think I literally been 5 times in 9 days of my stay. Such amazing facilities and such great service. The main bartender Von has fun evening martini pouring rituals that taste like one of the best drinks in Singapore. Try the Martini with elderflower. It‚Äôs so yum. I

title: BDAY STAYCATION
desc: St Regis Hotel did not disappoint. Excellent Service from the butler & housekeeping team. It‚Äôs pleasing to receive excellent service as our needs are well met. Especially the turn-down service before we sleep. The room we stayed (1914) was very clean. 5 ‚≠êÔ∏è indeed. Thank You St Regis Team.

title: Good service, overall clean hotel.
desc: Didn‚Äôt have to wait long in the queue for check in. Pleasantly surprised with the hotel kind gesture for the balloons, fruits and a cake for my birthday. I stayed for a night and I enjoyed my stay. The common area such as the lobby and gym was clean. Room was spectacular, though it was an executive room, I love how comfortable it was. I particularly enjoyed the 24 hour butler service which I can order coffee and tea at any time. However I had two encounters which I wasn‚Äôt quite happy with. As I stepped out of the room for dinner, housekeeping came in to clear my tea and conducted turndown service. Blinds were lowered, thank you, but there wasn‚Äôt turndown service for the bed. Instead what I saw was a tray which had the remote controllers and the breakfast menu on the bed.

title: One of the best
desc: Love the detail of the their bathroom feels like you‚Äôre a princess. They also have a butler service which is available for 24 hours, i think one of their bonus point. Good service provided by the staff and of the best hotel i‚Äôve been to.

title: Afternoon tea was worth it
desc: Came here for afternoon tea on a public holiday. Choose the At Regis Singapore blend tea and it was nice loved the sweets and the scones. The savory was great and sweets however were a bit too sweet for the price paid i think it was worth it usually afternoon only comes with the three tier and scones. This however came with savory and cream like chawanmushi plus strawberry jelly to end off. Overall the service was prompt and ambiance was great love the high ceiling.

title: Excellent service, comfortable and pampering stay. Great food too.
desc: Had a fantastic stay at the St Regis. The hotel was very accommodating to make this Mother‚Äôs Day staycation even more special. Spacious rooms, gorgeous bathroom and the most comfortable bedding. The service from the team is excellent - from the door to front desk, housekeeping and the team of butlers. Due to the current heighten alert, all dining was in room - but I felt it was a wonderful experience as the set up and service in the room was very prompt and well managed. It was very nice to actually have dinner and breakfast in the room. The food from Private Dining and Yan Ting was delicious. And the breakfast was a Wow too. Also loved the Bose sound system in the room ( 5 speakers) - which you don‚Äôt get nowadays is most newer hotels. Have to also mention the bathtub -

title: Amazing return stay
desc: Booked on stars rate Same impeccable standards throughout the entire hotel as always. Hotel was at high occupancy which notably took a toll on the butler service however it could be seen that the butlers' were trying their utmost best to upkeep the St Regis spirit. Kudos for that. Special thanks to Nicholas for his warm and hospitable service as always. Great aperitivo hour for platinum elite guest and above Food at brasserie les saveurs was equally fantastic and gastronomic. For breakfast, worthy highlight is amongst all the 5 star hotels in SG, St Regis breakfast namely pancakes and pastries remains unbeatable. Would definitely return again.

title: Excellent Experience -- Limited Spa Facilities
desc: Stayed at the St Regis twice in April 2021 as a Marriott Bonvoy Gold on the Stars rate. The rooms at the property were fantastic. I was upgraded on my first stay to a Penthouse King with a Botanic Gardens view while I requested for a lead-in category Executive Deluxe room for my second stay. Rooms in this property are as large as suites in others. The lead-in category room has a larger work desk and a nice couch along the window plus what feels like a more spacious bathroom (officially both are the same size). Breakfast at Brasserie Les Saveurs was excellent and offered sufficient variety. The freshly squeezed watermelon juice was a delight. The St Regis butlers offered great service, with the free-flowing coffee, tea, and hot chocolate fantastic touches in the morning and

title: Don‚Äôt stay in room 1616
desc: The first day was quite smooth and service was good from the check-in process to the butler service. Only issue was that pool was hard to book and we could not get a slot and the gym didn‚Äôt have a booking system so we had to keep checking if it was already at its maximum capacity of 5. However, the terrifying part came when the phone speaker suddenly switched on by itself in the middle of the night about 4am, waking us up with a super loud dial tone. After a few seconds it switched off by itself. I was horrified and told my husband I wanted to change rooms because I have no idea how that can be a technical glitch and neither of us switched the speaker on FOR SURE. Then we went down there was nobody at the check-in counter and reception area and the whole hotel seemed totally

title: Beautiful Room and Warm Hospitality, We'll Be Back!
desc: Couple staycation from 7th to 8th May. Pre-arrival email was sent by their Reservations Team, who assisted with my inquiries, Afternoon Tea reservation, and delivery arrangement. We were graciously offered early check in, but I had to decline due to work commitments. Check in was by cheerful Ms Daenny, who discreetly followed up with my prior request when my partner stepped away to explore the hotel lobby. Thanks to her and the team, I managed to surprise my partner with flowers. The Executive Deluxe Room had a spacious living room, with a comfortable bed that gave us a good night's sleep, and the bathroom had a tub to soak in. We were given a high floor, and amenities such as TWG tea and bottled water were well-stocked. After exploring the room features and some photos

title: Beautiful Wedding at Caroline's Mansion
desc: We got married at Caroline's Mansion (St Regis Singapore) during the Covid-19 Phase 2 (Heightened Alert) period. As a result, several changes had to be made due to the restrictions. Christine from the Wedding Team was with us throughout the planning stages, and we are very appreciative of her. On our wedding day, everything went smoothly and we could enjoy the celebrations. Credits to Christine and her Team. They were awesome! We also stayed at the St Regis suite. The service rendered to us was top-notched. The breakfast was sumptuous. And most importantly the room was spacious, classy and comfortable!

title: A memorable staycation with plenty to offer!
desc: This is our 3rd stay with the hotel and all the staff that we came across, once again, impressed us with their elevated customer service standards, that we will never be able to forget. Special kudos to Mescon for making our breakfast experience the best part of our wonderful staycation. We will definitely be back again.

title: Elegant Stay at St. Regis Singapore
desc: Having done numerous staycations of late due to the current travel restrictions. I am impressed by what St. Regis has on offer for Staycationers. I stayed earlier in May before the recent circuit breaker measure were announced (How lucky was I?) Before arrival to the hotel. I received a notification via the Bonvoy app noting my room was ready. As I booked directly with the hotel. This option was available and it was so useful as I was able to communicate to the team via the chat function. Guest also are entitled to 1 complimentary parking ticket per day during their stay. I was greeted by Sam, who was ever so friendly and assisted me with my luggage. The friendliness of the doorman team just elevates one's stay knowing they had a great arrival experience. I was checked in by

title: Hotel with very good staff but lots of issues
desc: I really like the service I get from st Regis , the people are warm and friendly , one of the best I encountered which I will give 5/5 But I have a very mixed experience from this hotel in just one day The worse is my room had technical issues and the all the lights plus the tv went on by their own in the midnight for 4 times , from 2:40am to 4am and My whole family had a really terrible sleep , I never have this experience before from any hotels in my life and it‚Äôs really terrible, maybe st Regis will want to change back to the good old traditional switch so at least the lights stayed off when you off the button After the fourth time I was totally awake and really pissed off when I called the butler and he send up a technician to reset the room setting then finally we

title: luxurious stay in St Regis during Singapore Pharse 2 (Heightened Alert)
desc: Mariott Bonvoy chain got nice hotel with nice view near the sea and river. Last month, I picked Ritz Carlton but I cancelled the reservation because authorities here issued temporarily ban of dining-in and thus no dining in at club lounge. I came to know about St Regis after watching Youtube influencer ( two man team) tale of St Regis Singapore. I decided to choose this hotel and need a butler to help me in food delivery to my room. I picked St Regis Suite (junior Suite) and ordered Afternoon Tea set. During Check in, the reservation team was very helpful and duty manager led me to the room. I was impressed by the decor of the room. I am actually deaf, and am amazed by the Marriot Bonvoy app which have chat function which allow me to get in room dining,, I had afternoon tea,

title: Comfortable & luxurious stay!
desc: Stayed over the weekend and the room was amazing! The mini fridge wasn't cold at all hence we contacted the operator, and the engineering staff (Mr Jack Hua) that came was super helpful :) In-room breakfast was good as well. Overall a very enjoyable stay!!

title: Belated birthday staycation during heightened alert
desc: Not having had the luxury of travelling abroad for a long time now, my friends and I have made it a point to do a staycation about once every quarter. As we'd heard great things about St. Regis's butler services and their Remede spa, we decided that for our mid-year staycation (which coincides with my friend's birthday), we'd give St. Regis Singapore a go. Firstly, given our occasion and my requests for early check-in and a room on a higher floor, the check-in team did a brilliant job in preparing a birthday cake for my friend, balloons, and gifted us a room on the top-floor complete with complimentary early check-in at 10am (instead of 3pm). We really appreciated this gesture. We booked a spa getaway package as part of our Staycation, and opted for a 45 minute Remede foot spa

title: No words just amazing
desc: If u r looking for a luxury hotel, st regis is d 1.. Amazing experience.. All the staff that i've encounter was very approachable.. No matter where u r within the hotel, they will greet u.. I had an amazing service checking in smoothly n check out smoothly.. The room was clean, spotless.. I will definitely come back.. I had an amazing birthday stayca.. Thank u st regis

title: Caroline Astor Suite
desc: Heard St.Regis offer one of the best service so we chose to have 4D3N stay at the Caroline Astor Suite. There were 3 check in desks and each time after a check in is done, the table will be sanitised which is a good practise. There is always a line to the check in with an average of 7 to 10 min wait. For the CAS, each adult guest get a complimentary cocktail from The Astor Bar, 2 complimentary breakfast, 2 complimentary pressing, pay-per-view are complimentary too. There's unpacking & packing service provided. Since covid, we've stayed in many different hotels including some suites. So far all the hotels we've visited allocate at least 2 hours of swim time per slot and some even offer up to 2 slots per day. But not here so this is quite a disappointment. We tried heading

title: Dim Sum Standards Have Dropped and Supper Club Benefits Are Poorly Administered
desc: Ate at Yan Ting for Dim Sum today. New Dim Sum chef has led to drop in standards. Poor taste. Also, it was my birthday month and the Supper Club tran failed to reply emails or calls - so I did not receive my free cake and birthday champagne. St Regis need to better administer the Supper Club benefits.

title: Relaxing and quiet atmosphere - read also review by Artificial Intelligence
desc: 'About Last Night - Your resting heart rate shows that your body has recovered well. Think back to last night: Can you identify a routine that could've helped you to achieve this?' Yes, this was the message of Oura Smart ring after sleeping one night at the hotel! The room is quiet, bed is excellent and it is place meant to wind down. The size of the room is good for two people and generally it feels luxurious. Bose sound system is a bit dated, its remote control didn't work and it was not possible to find HDMI plug for iPad. These days soundbar with subwoofer provides better sound quality. The batteries for the remote were changed, but it didn't start working. I didn't want anyone in the room to fix Bose any further, and we managed it manually. Still better than TV sound.

title: Absurd experience thanks to Magdeleine and Radu
desc: Booked 5 nights at Penthouse king, garden view/high floor. Off the bat immediate problems from the front house manager Magdeleine who offered an "upgrade" (part of my Bonvoy status) to a literally cheaper room on their booking page with twin beds on a lower floor. She insisted this is the best she was willing to offer. Would later be offered an actual upgrade, lots were available in this half empty hotel. The Penthouse room is an old room that smelled strongly of smoke. Magdeleine's solution was to "spray it down" for us... right... just mask the smell with chemicals for our stay. title: Lovely stay
desc: The St Regis in Singapore was gorgeous. One of the highest standards anywhere that we have seen. We had four children with us, and it was a lovely time. The food was wonderful. The pool is beautiful (you wouldn‚Äôt even know you are in the heart of the city) but on the smaller side

title: Luxury Stay
desc: We had 2 nights stay and booked 2 rooms. Check in was smooth and rooms were well appointed, spacious with super comfy beds. Well furnished with adequate amenities. What stood out most were the staff, very welcoming, friendly & accommodating. Room service & breakfast were awesome too. Everything is remarkable & will definitely return for staycation again!

title: Amazing stay, excellent hospitality
desc: First time trying out St Regis, have to say that I am impressed! All staff greeted us with smiles and enthusiasm from start to end. The butler service & housekeeping were all quick and efficient. I love how the rooms are designed, not to mention the bathroom :) Missed out on several items in the vanity kit but no biggie. A big warm thank you to Kaung Sett for making my trip a memorable one. Was impressed by his great hospitality and kindness, such as arrangements for a complimentary upgrade and breakfast! Made my stay even better. Also to Valerie for welcoming us so warmly. Will return!

title: An Awesome Dining Experience at Yan Ting
desc: My friends and I had a lovely dining experience at Yan Ting tonight. The food was awesome and we were wowed by the exceptional service from Weng. Our compliments to the Chef & his team. A refurbishment would definitely improve the ambience of the restaurant. Overall, love the food & exceptional service. We will definitely be back!

title: Spectacular service despite tough time
desc: I had an awesome staycation experience at St Regis for 2 nights for my birthday. It‚Äôs the best staycation I had so far in Singapore, it‚Äôs challenging time for hospitality industry and you could feel the team at St Regis are trying their best to make the guest experience a memorable one. The willingness to serve attitude is clearly visible from doorman to their front of house, butler and in room dining teams. I‚Äôm so indulged by St Regis throughout the 2 days, I was given a free room upgrade and late check out upon check-in as my birthday treat. When arrived in the room, I was presented with a box of chocolates and fruits. On day 2, my room access card has problem and I could not access the room, they resolved it rather quick. Shortly after, the butler came by to give me some

We even noticed the table that came later than us got the food ahead. Finally the food arrived and I informed a male service staff in black jacket (his name begin with "K" ) we waited for an hour to be served, his

title: Great stay
desc: Had my second staycation at the St Regis Singapore. Staffs at the hotel reception were warm and friendly, as always! Special thanks to Sage, Wilbur, Amy & Magdelene. As an ex-hotelier, I must say that Sage followed closely to the check-in procedure for elite members. The benefits of a gold elite member were well respected. Once again, thank you all for the arrangements. Stay safe and well.

title: Good experience (Caroline Astor Suite)
desc: Booked Caroline Astor Suite for 2 nights. The hotel looks really fully booked, probably of staycations by other locals. I tried to ask for early check-in and late check-out but didn't get it. Was a bit shocked as I was checking out on Monday and the reception told me that all suites are booked so, there is no late check-out. The good points: The in-room breakfast(St Regis breakfast for Suites) was much better than the ones in the restaurant. You know the difference after you tried it! The Suite is quite spacious and easily accommodate a family. Service by the staff are professional and they followed up on your request(Take a bit of time). I had the whole pool to myself and my wife. Not so good: The in-room service is kinda slow. I asked and paid for an extra bed, but it was

title: In the Lap of Luxury
desc: Everything about this hotel spells luxury. From the decor of the hotel, including the room I was assigned to; to the facilities and more. I would not have expected anything less from this luxury brand, and so the service rendered from the minute I stepped in, to my departure was nothing short of wonderful. The room was well appointed and had everything a guest needed. Whether you are staying for business or leisure, you will be satisfied with what the room has to offer. I would like to extend a big round of applause to every associate for the impeccable service rendered. Front office associates Shah and Shannon were very helpful from the get-go. I had sent a request to the hotel to have my bicycle stored in the luggage storage room, and Shah made sure this was carried out

title: Wonderful Staycation Experience
desc: I booked this staycation to celebrate my spouse's birthday. After the booking, I emailed the hotel to request for early check-in and to prepare a surprise for my spouse. They were very friendly and tried their best to make our stay memorable. On the day of check-in, I was allowed to have an early check-in. The check-in process was quick and Sage assisted us. We were given high floor for this celebration and they prepared balloons and a cake for my spouse. The room was very spacious and clean, and the bathtub was very inviting. haha... App was used to book the facilities and our breakfast timing. We were able to use the pool. It was big and not crowded. As we have dining credits, we utilised it for the Fossa Chocolate High Tea. It was a great experience with quality food.

title: NOT impressed
desc: This place does not deserve to be a six star hotel. It needs to do better in every aspect. I stayed in the Caroline Astor Suite, and you would‚Äôve thought all guests would deserve some kind of respect. Sadly that was not the case. I read in many of the reviews below that the service standards are dismal and I fully agree. Scroll down and you‚Äôd see a complaint on Magdeleine, the front house manager with the horrid service attitude and I am disappointed to say that her behaviour has not been rectified or improved since that review of stay in July 2021. She was in charge of our check- in and was rude from start to end, especially when my trace together app could not start up. First, I am vaccinated. I understand that checks would be stringent in the midst of existing SMM,

title: A passable solo staycation at The St. Regis Singapore
desc: I booked a weekend stay at The St. Regis Singapore in the Caroline Astor Suite (Room 1501). The suite itself was as one might expect from a St. Regis-branded hotel ‚Äî unapologetically luxurious.
