The problem came at night whilst I was

title: Awesome birthday celebration.
desc: I'd like to compliment Sage-Front office , for the excellent service she provided. Attention to details, great communication skills..and always with a smile made the experience even better. Breakfast at the Brasserie Le Saveurs was awesome especially the French toast. Friendly staffs and prompt service. Thank you for the birthday cake that's was place in the room, my friend was so delighted. Thank you.

title: Service not up-to a St Regis standard.
desc: Service is terrible, I could never get hold of a butler even after 10 rings. Nobody would call back. Staff was not helpful. Even after speaking to the duty manager to share my experience there was no improvement and they continue to not be able to provide a satisfactory service.

title: Nice staycation
desc: I like the location that it is just off the main shopping belt so you don't feel too rushed. So far all the staff that I had encountered in the hotel has shown excellent service so kudos. The only gripe is that we ordered some tea and it didnt showed up. So we had to call again to remind them, quite sad given 'butler' service should not need to be reminded I would think.

title: Lovely Stay!
desc: We had a fantastic time at this fine hotel! There was an ongoing promotion with Amex, giving $100 off the price which made the deal even sweeter! Stayed for 3 nights with breakfast included. The breakfast was fantastic with quite a few choices, but I made it a point to order the famous epicurean omelet on most mornings. The omelet was delicious, with fresh prawns and caviar. The supporting players like the nasi lemak, laksa, waffle and pancakes were also good. Very high class breakfast and would be sure to return! Being booked on a Stars rate, I had usd100 go burn which I used at Yan Ting and Drawing Room. These two fine establishments also impressed me, with the standard of the food high as well as the ambience and professionalism of the staff. I was booked into a basic

title: NICE STAY to end the december holidays
desc: Stayed in St Regis in January on a staycation with my family. As we are titanium member, and using the suite upgrade certificates, we were upgraded to the castor suite which is very nicely put together. Nice weather coupled with a nice pool makes for a good break before school starts. No lounges were available, and while the fittings in SR SG is not as opulant as that in SR NY, it is still very nice. Check in was smooth. Butler service was abit of hit and miss, some minor misunderstanding which was quickly cleared up by Dominic Chong, who also gave us very good attention and support throughout our stay. Spa was great, with Covid restrictions in place, it was very serene and relaxing without the usual crowd. Location was off orchard road but its like a 10 minutes walk to get to

desc: We had a great experience the moment we stepped into the hotel. Valarie, from the front desk, was very attentive to our needs, and recommended a few locations for lunch after knowing that we haven't had ours. She also built a great rapport with our kids right off the bat. The inhouse butler service was a great feature and the team was very accommodating during our stay. Room was clean and amenities aplenty. Swimming pool was 'enclosed' but gym was well equipped. Overall, a very enjoyable stay. Will return soon!

title: I would give 5 stars but some issues on first night & discrepancies with advertised services. Service impeccable.
desc: Now I am quite reluctant to give 4 stars when really the service was exceeding 5 stars. I feel the price we paid was several hundred pounds lost for our first night expected experience, which made us tired for the first few days. Also it mentions complimentary butler tea and coffee

title: Family Holiday
desc: The hotel is quite good in terms of room size, 5 stars atmosphere, although the hotel building is quite old but very well maintained, the staff was very friendly and helpful in particular at reception lobby, arrival greetings except staff in restaurant (breakfast) because they were just okay. however the breakfast were good, they served delicious meal of nasi lemak, salmon rice and laksa singapore. we loved it. Meanwhile, I remember the lady staff with bangs hair and glasses, she was very kind and helpful and also a concierge staff named Mr. Shalihin who was super kind and helpful. Further, the hotel location is quite strategic and walking distance to nearest shopping center like orchard.

title: ABSOLUTELY INCREDIBLE 6 STAR PROPERTY
desc: Where do I begin......... I have had the privilege of traveling the world in my 38 years of life, I have stayed at some stunning properties from 6 stars to hostels backpacking thru Europe. St Regis Singapore is the absolute My Everest of True Luxury. When you step foot inside this magnificent hotel you are blown away by the elegance and prestige. The whole property is magical and we were lucky

title: Excellent hotel that is totally stunning and top notch service!
desc: Excellent hotel that is totally stunning and top notch service! They even arrange a birthday cake for me when they know I'm celebrating a special occasion there :) Even managed to customize the cake to my preference! 5 stars experience!

title: One of the best hotels I been to.
desc: Overall ambience is great. All hotel staffs have great service and I like their butler service. The food is great for the in room dining and there‚Äôs a wide selection of semi buffet breakfast at the French restaurent. desc: I have stayed at the St Regis Singapore more than 25 times since in opened more than a decade ago and admittedly this was my first visit post pandemic but I was highly disappointed in my experience. Some data points: - they are very understaffed and have reduced the porter/doorman service to one which makes getting a taxi/car and unloading luggage impossible. We had to bring our own bags inside and no one greeted us. - it took 45 minutes to check in and while the front desk was very friendly, they were extremely slow and caused us to be late for a dinner. There was nothing complicated about our reservation so I don't understand why it took so long. - the beds remain the highlight of the rooms but the decor and technology needs updating. One of the bedside light control unit

desc: The hotel is really luxurious and rooms are spacious with all modern facilities. its also conveniently located right off Orchard Street. The butler service was excellent and special thanks to the Indian chef Kamal for accommodating requests of Indian food for our young kids. They also provided in the room for all baby amenities like high chair, changing mat, steriliser etc. However, the hotel seems to be understaffed. You could see the staff trying hard to manage, but check in took almost 30 minutes, breakfast specially on the weekends was chaotic ( on Sunday we had to wait an hour before we got a table). They asked us to book time slots for breakfast while check in, but the restaurant wasn't really honouring those.

title: Nothing short of outstanding!
desc: I stayed in room 2013 at this gorgeous property for a night during my birthday last Friday, and am still reminiscing about this recent staycation. Extremely well-equipped and great selection of restaurants within the hotel. The breakfast spread was outstanding too. One does not need to leave the premises to have a whale of a time really, but even if one does, the excellent location will be sure to please. I would like to give a special compliment to Candy and Chloe from the hotel front desk and Brasserie Les Saveurs respectively. Both of these fine individuals have made my recent experience at the St. Regis an extremely pleasant and seamless one with their outstanding service attitude that is constantly brimming with genuine warmth. A big thank you to the entire team for the

title: Fantastic stay
desc: I stayed at the St Regis Residences with my husband since April 2021. The people working there have been treating us very well. I love that everyone is so friendly and nice. I really miss them very much. The service is really fantastic there and they are always very polite.

title: Great room comfort and an overall lovely stay but disappointing breakfast
desc: Stayed end of Nov 2022 Pros: -lots of art work in the lobby and there was a christmas tree in the middle. there is a bar. there's a piano and more art on lvl 1u and some function reading room and even more seating areas. -check in person was professional, although there was a slight hiccup with the booking due to a misunderstanding on his part but it was rectified after he further investigated. -corridors are not musky smelling. -butler can bring you tea as a welcome drink or between 6-11am i think -room is amazing more classic style and everything smells nice -room is huge in size even for the lowest category room which is what we stayed in. -room has a tray to put your keycard -in room has nice marble and carpeted areas -has complimentary tea (chamomile, green, black

title: Most comfortable stay at this refined and luxurious hotel, in quieter top end of Orchard Hotel
desc: Spent a most comfortable & relaxing 2 week stay at the St Regis, after medical treatment. We had a large upgraded room with two double beds. The Hotel exudes refined luxury, & service throughout is excellent & discrete. Special mention goes to the doormen & concierge at the entrance. There is an abundance of beautiful specially commissioned paintings & sculptures, adorning the lobby & public spaces. My wife & I enjoyed the breakfast buffet, with its wide choice & excellent pastries. One minor complaint is the Lounge to right of Reception, is too dim, & not conducive for casual meetings. I much prefer the Saveurs Brasserie with its better natural light . Service can also be patchy , as there may be shortage of staff Overall we had an excellent stay. Highly Recommended

title: Didn‚Äôt live up with it standard and as Luxury hotel
desc: St Regis didn‚Äôt exceed our expectation as it titled. Bonvoy Gold member didn‚Äôt seem recognized upon check-In even though we have put in the membership when we did the booking through the bonvoy app. Seriously understaff at the F&B restaurant. What surprised us was her readiness and willingness to go the extra mile for her clients. üòÆ For example, on our first meeting (7 months before the wedding) she was already helping us brainstorm quality vendors and ideas for our wedding, even without us asking. desc: We had booked a suite room for 3 nights. It wasn‚Äôt ready upon check-in, which was a surprise but we could accept. However, what was unprofessional in the hospitality industry is how my husband had to call TWICE to see if the room was ready within the next 90 minutes. And no, the room wasn‚Äôt ready. The manager was wearing a frown on her face the whole time ‚Äî a stark contrast to the smiling faces of the managers who were very warm, patient and yes, hospitable, in our previous stays. ‚ÄúThank you. Please. Welcome.‚Äù weren‚Äôt part of her vocabulary. For an elegant hotel as St Regis, this attitude is unbefitting. Having paid SGD5600+, I would say this amount could be better spent in other hotels

title: VIP first experience staying in St. Regis
desc: I have to give St. Regis a 5 stars for my stay there. Every aspect of this stay is exemplary of what a 5 stars hotel should be like from checking in, dining, room services, the lounge and checking out. The staffs are warm, helpful and very professional. I would like to especially thanks the front desk manager Syikin, the staffs at the French Restaurant and Astor Bar for making my daughter's and wife's birthday an exceptionally memorable one. Thank you so much.

title: A lovely hotel I would rate 4.5 if there was that category
desc: We had a wonderful 4 day stay at this hotel. Check-in was slow and more staff should have been called to move the process along. When we went up to our room there was a line of 6 or 7 guests. The front desk does check-in and also serves as the concierge. The hotel was crowded on the weekend but it did not affect our stay. The breakfast buffet was plentiful and good. Our king sized room was large with an entryway area, 2 sofas and a desk and chair. The bed was comfortable. Towels were nice. Each nightstand had controls labeling all of the lights and the curtains. That was wonderful. The bathroom was huge with 2

desc: The lobby is super impressive on arrival, and the experience is retained through to the beautiful rooms. There is an ambience of class and luxury to the hotel. There is a really nice bar (astor) in the hotel serving top notch cocktails. The pool whilst on a low floor had a lovely secluded feel and was never vaguely busy during our stay. The room itself was well appointed with a super comfy bed. The bathroom was not cleaned in a couple of obvious places when we arrived, which for the ¬£400 per night price tag is not acceptable. But the problem was swiftly rectified and there was no repeat. The location is nice as it is slightly set away from the hectic orchard road but is just a short walk to the MRT which you use to get around all of singapore pretty much. And also handy for

title: Awesome experience!
desc: Despite it was a fully booked day for the hotel, the experience for our family was awesome! Treatment of all guests as VIP and providing personalised encounters for them. Was utterly surprised to receive a hand written welcome note from the General Manager, Mr Allen. Was treated with first class service from our butler Mr Kumar Pakirisamy, who took care of us personally during our stay and remembered our special occasions and needs. Even the staff at Brasserie Les Saveurs kept checking in on us during our breakfast, to see if we need anything else. Kudos to St Regis Singapore team!

title: Truly wonderful
desc: Loved every minute of our short break ‚Äî the room was so comfortable (Bose surround sound speakers and the fluffiest pillows), the service at the hotel was impeccable and we enjoyed our mini-art tour with Wilbur very much. Breakfast was excellent with a range of non-dairy options, surprise birthday macarons, and a choice of the FT, NYT and ST to peruse over an unhurried meal. One of the kind staff even gave us some cake to take home to our young daughters at the end of our visit. Top marks and we hope to be back soon.

title: Five star location, two star service
desc: Good location, outdated facilities, and terrible service. The staff has no idea of service, one of the worst experiences in Asia for a five star hotel. Hard to understand how it became a St. Regis. The room was not ready when I checked in after multiple prior confirmation. title: St regis singapore down the hill‚Ä¶ or st regis brand is lowering their quality?
desc: I used to love this hotel where it was exclusive and top notch service. Worth comparing to four seasons and alike. Few years later, this become a main stream hotel. Should not be given brand st regis anymore. Or maybe st regis has lowered their market? Definitely not worth the luxury that it claim has

title: First time in Singapore - Amazing Hotel

title: The lobby was a let down
desc: Entrance and lobby did not give the warm welcome I had expected. Breakfast was crammed and options were not plenty. Other than that the experience was great. The rooms are well appointed, service impeccable and prompt and location is unbeatable.

I was tired, frustrated and confused. I decided to approach
